lines.content: This is the user guide for the Binks task manager :)
* [`mark` - Marks the corresponding task with an 'X'](#mark---marks-the-corresponding-task-with-an-x)
* [`todo` - Adds a todo task into the list](#todo---Adds-a-todo-task-into-the-list)
* [`deadline` - Adds a todo task into the list](#deadline---Adds-a-todo-task-into-the-list)
* [`event` - Adds an event task into the list](#event---Adds-an-event-task-into-the-list)
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for your chatbot.
4. Open a command terminal, cd into the folder you put the jar file in
5. Use the java -jar ip.jar command to run the application.
6. A GUI similar to the below should appear in a few seconds.
Users are able to add and delete todo, deadline and event type tasks as well as mark and unmark them based on whether or not the task is completed.
Upon exiting the chatbot, the list that the user has input will be saved and re-uploaded when the user comes back.
### `list` - Lists out the current task list
After you type `list`, the chatbot will output the task list
Here are the tasks in you list:
### `mark` - Marks the corresponding task with an 'X'
After you type `mark INDEX`, mark the task with the corresponding index with an 'X'.
Nice! I have marked this task as done:
After you type `unmark INDEX`, unmarks the corresponding task.
OK, I have marked this task as not done yet:
After you type `bye`, exit the chatbot
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
### `todo` - Adds a todo task into the list
After you type `todo`, adds a todo task into the list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
### `deadline` - Adds a todo task into the list
After you type `deadline TASK /by TIME`, adds a deadline task into the list with the due time
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
### `event` - Adds an event task into the list
After you type `event TASK /from TIME /to TIME`, adds a event task into the list with the to and from time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
### `delete` - Deletes a task from the list
After you type `delete INDEX`, deletes the task with the corresponding index.
After you type `find KEYWORD`, finds the task in the list that contains the corresponding keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:

* Handles the case where the mark command is given as input
* @param command Command array of input string without spaces
public static void markCommand(String[] command, List list) throws BinksException {
throw new BinksException("Please specify which task to mark.");
* Handles the case where the unmark command is given as input
* @param command Command array of input string without spaces
public static void unmarkCommand(String[] command, List list) throws BinksException {
throw new BinksException("Please specify which task to unmark!");
* Handles the case where the todo command is given as input
* @param line Line of the initial command string including spaces
* @param command Command array of input string without spaces
public static void todoCommand(String line, String[] command, List list) throws BinksException {
throw new BinksException("The description of todo cannot be empty!");
* Handles the case where the deadline command is given as input

* @param command Command array of input string without spaces
* @throws BinksException when command.length < 2 or deadline is not given
public static void deadlineCommand(String line, String[] command, List list) throws BinksException {
throw new BinksException("Please indicate a deadline using /by!");
throw new BinksException("The description of deadline cannot be empty!");
* Handles the case where the event command is given as input

* @param command Command array of input string without spaces
* @throws BinksException when command.length < 2 or timeframe is not given
public static void eventCommand(String line, String[] command, List list) throws BinksException {
throw new BinksException("Please specify start and end times using /from and /to!");
throw new BinksException("The description of event cannot be empty!");

* Obtains and prints out the task list as well as whether it is marked as done or not done.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Adds the todo task into the task list
* @param task Todo task that is being added to the task list
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Adds the deadline task into the task list
* @param task Deadline task that is being added to the task list
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Adds the event task into the task list
* @param task Event task that is being added to the task list
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Marks the task as done by adding an "X" in the square brackets and prints out the task that is done.
* @param index Index of the task that is marked as done
System.out.println("Nice! I have marked this task as done:");
* Marks the task as not done by removing the "X" in the square brackets and prints out the task that is being
* @param index Index of the task that is being marked as undone
System.out.println("OK, I have marked this task as not done yet:");
* Deletes the corresponding task that is given by the index that is input.
* @param index Index of the task that is being marked as undone
System.out.println("You now have " + list.size() + " tasks left");
* Finds the task that contains the keyword that is placed in the input.
* @param keyword Keyword that we want to find among all the tasks in the list
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("No matching tasks found for the keyword: " + keyword);
* Updates the text file with the updated version of our task list.
* @param list list of tasks that we want to store into the text file
fw.write(task + "\n"); // Assuming each task is represented as a single line
* Changes the boolean variable isDone to true to show that task is done.
* Changes the boolean variable isDone to false to show that task is not done.
* Returns true if the task is done and false if the task is not done
